embeds.title: Inflict Agony
embeds.description:
Common Attack / 2 :energy_collector: / The Collector / Downfall

Deal 12 (18) damage.
If the enemy is not **Afflicted,** apply 2 **Weak** :p_weak: and **Vulnerable** :p_vulnerable:.

messages.content: <UPPERCUT>

embeds.title: Uppercut
embeds.description:
Uncommon Attack / 2 :red_energy: / The Ironclad / Slay the Spire

Deal 13 damage.
Apply 1 (2) **Weak** :p_weak:.
Apply 1 (2) **Vulnerable** :p_vulnerable:.

messages.content: this card is uncommon now
bot needs an update
Collector’s Uppercut
easy snap pick early
even if you don’t land the weak vuln who cares 27 to the face
later depends a bit on how your deck is dealing damage or applying afflicted

A very powerful card, applying 2 weak and 2 vulnerable while dealing respectable damage for 2 energy is extremely efficient, and can enable several of collectors synergies (Doom stacking and affliction matters). Compares very favorably to uppercut and clothesline. The catch is that if the enemy is already afflicted, you just get the damage, which makes it a far worse card, but you have to keep in mind that if the enemy is already afflicted, then things are likely going well for you in that fight. I can deal with a card having some inconsistency issues if they mostly apply in situations that are naturally good for me. Also keep in mind that in fights with multiple enemies, it will almost always be able to apply the conditions to someone.

The upgrade is quite good, a +6 can really help your front-loading needs in short and medium length fights. In act 1 especially, the damage is very valuable, and the conditions can also help clear tough fights like gremlin nob and lagavulin more cleanly. It definitely falls off somewhat later in the run, as the damage is less valuable, and your deck probably has found some other ways to apply conditions like Dark Lord Form. If you find one early, it's a great pickup, but if you don't see one until later on (more likely now that it's uncommon) then you do have to consider how effectively your current deck applies afflicted before taking it. Good with either snecko eye or runic pyramid, and does solid damage with necronomicon.
this card was really broken before its nerf. Its still pretty strong now, i'd even say that its upgrade giving you +6 damage still makes it pretty overtuned

when its unupgraded its value is closer to that of uppercut; although still better since it provides double the debuffs and is on a character which has stronger synergy with them. Upgrading to get +18 damage makes this card worth playing on an enemy which is already afflicted since it just does good damage at that point; which sort of goes ageist the cards design.
wait I just realized, since we've recently had the dice crush discussion, let's compare <dice crush>'s damage to this

embeds.title: Tail Whip
embeds.description:
Basic Attack / 2 :energy_snek: / The Snecko / Downfall

Deal 10 (13) damage.
Apply 0 (1) - 2 **Weak** :p_weak:.
Apply 0 (1) - 2 **Vulnerable** :p_vulnerable:.

messages.content: tbh tail whip is a basic but still sadpercut
most of snecko's cards are sad versions of other cards

Which I'm not entirely against the idea of that being the case if any of these situations were true
A) They were consistent
B) There was more consistent alternatives
C) They synergized well with each other/off color cards
D) They were of a similar power level (funny infinite draw go brrr)
tbh I would like tail whip much more if it were 1-2 weak/vuln by base and upgrade made it 1-3
the main problem with unupgraded tail whip is that you can get xcomed and die
that would not be very sadpercut, unfortunately
1-2 by base tail whip- might even be slightly preferable to uppercut-
“Base game card but sad” is not something I want to strive to
Not having a single reliable option is just the snecko experience
exotic form is reliable
too reliable
Yes but getting a specific rare isn't
6 damage upgrade is pretty standard for a 2 cost common/uncommon attack that hits once. That's like playing 2 strikes vs 2 upgraded strikes

Most cards that have a +6 upgrade or more have much higher numbers, like <automa-beam>, <immolate>and <greater hurting>. Other 2 cost single hit attacks that are in the 15'ish damage range, like <toasty> <predator> <sneaky strike>, and <sword of night> all have lower more reasonable upgrades.

but I get your point
